channel.title: BBC News - Entertainment & Arts
channel.description: The latest stories from the Entertainment & Arts section of the BBC News web site.
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Son's death 'devastates' Stallone
item.description: The sudden death in Hollywood of Sylvester Stallone's 36-year-old son Sage leaves the star "devastated and grief-stricken".

item.title: West End show Chicago to close
item.description: Long-running West End musical Chicago will close at the end of the summer, after nearly 15 years.

item.title: Blur announce live BBC radio show
item.description: Blur are to play a live show for BBC radio, ahead of their comeback gigs in London's Hyde Park.

item.title: Film producer Richard Zanuck dies
item.description: Richard Zanuck, producer of classic Hollywood films such as The Sound of Music and Jaws, dies aged 77.

item.title: Poet Duffy awarded Pinter prize
item.description: Poet Laureate Carol Ann Duffy says she is "hugely honoured" by being awarded the 2012 Pen Pinter Prize in memory of the playwright Harold Pinter.

item.title: Cruise lawyer threatens to sue
item.description: Tom Cruise's lawyer threatens the National Enquirer with legal action over a story about the actor's split from Katie Holmes which calls him "a monster".

item.title: Waters tops global ticket sales
item.description: Former Pink Floyd star Roger Waters tops worldwide concert ticket sales for 2012 so far, outselling Bruce Springsteen and Madonna, according to Pollstar.
